resources.string:
Thank you for contributing radio data related to this security event and supporting SnoopSnitch research and development!
 
 Please share additional details about this incident: snoopsnitch@srlabs.de (PGP fingerprint 9728 A7F9 D457 1FBB 746F 5381 D52C AC10 634A 9561). Do not forget your App-ID and the time the event happened. Thank you!
 
 This upload is encrypted. Keep in mind that radio traces may contain private data and location information.

DO NOT PICK UP THE PHONE AND DO NOT REJECT THE CALL WHEN THE SERVER CALLS. IF YOU DO SO, YOUR NUMBER WILL GET BLACKLISTED AND BANNED FROM THE SERVICE.
 
 The active network test collects security information about your current mobile network by sending and receiving a number of SMS and by placing and receiving a number of automatic calls.
 
 It is normal to receive error status SMS from your operator during that test. The test should be free of charge. HOWEVER, YOUR OPERATOR MAY CHARGE YOU FOR OUTGOING SMS EVEN IF SENT TO AN INVALID DESTINATION!
 
 YOU MUST ONLY ENTER YOUR OWN PHONE NUMBER IN THE NEXT DIALOG.
 Also make sure to enter your number in international format prefixed by your country code as follows:
 
 +[country-code][your-number]
 
 For example, a German (+49) number of 12345678 would be written:
 +4912345678

Following the test, the resulting radio data is uploaded to our servers. If you do not agree with this, press Cancel now and disable recording for active network tests in the settings menu. Note that radio traces may contain private data and location information as a side effect.\n

Welcome! This is your first time running SnoopSnitch.
 
 SnoopSnitch analyzes Android patch information and collects and analyzes mobile radio data to make you aware of your mobile network security and to warn you about threats like fake base stations (IMSI catchers), user tracking and over-the-air updates.
 
 This application uses data contributed by other users. By choosing to upload your measurement results or security events, you can help improve this data and support future research.
 
 SnoopSnitch will ask for confirmation whenever any of your mobile network information is uploaded to our servers. All uploads are encrypted. Note that uploaded radio traces may contain private information as a side-effect.
 
 Thank you for using SnoopSnitch.
SnoopSnitch will not be able to perform mobile network tests, as long as the Airplane Mode is turned on.\n \n Please turn the Airplane Mode off and retry this test.

SnoopSnitch is an open source Android app that offers you the opportunity to test the security of your mobile device as well as of the mobile networks to which your device connects.

SnoopSnitch offers two core security testing features:


*Android patch level analysis*

SnoopSnitch's latest feature are tests to analyze whether a device’s build of Android OS is missing security patches that should be included relative to the device’s current security patch level date.
 NOTE: These tests will work on all Android devices.


*Mobile network security tests*

SnoopSnitch's original security tests focus identifying potential attacks or surveillance against an individual device from the mobile network. SnoopSnitch collects and analyzes mobile radio data to make you aware of the overall security of the mobile network to which your device is connected and to warn you about threats like fake base stations (IMSI catchers) and user tracking.
 NOTE: These tests will only work on Android devices with root access and a Qualcomm chipset.

For additional information, including an FAQ, privacy policy, and app source code, please visit our SnoopSnitch project website at:

https://opensource.srlabs.de/projects/snoopsnitch
Start the SnoopSnitch background service automatically when the device is booted
Radio traces are purged from the phone that often
Information about your location is purged from the phone that often
Data from catcher and event analysis is purged from the phone that often
Debug logs are purged from the phone that often
Catcher and event metadata is purged from the phone that often
Use fine-grained GPS-based location recording to get location information for IMSI catcher and security events
Use coarse-grained network-based location recording to get location information for IMSI catcher and security events
Record log files in plaintext. Sensitive information is NOT removed from the device for you!
Record dump files in plaintext. Sensitive information is NOT removed from the device for you!
Store radio data encrypted with our public key.
Store event dump files unencrypted on phone. Sensitive information is NOT removed from the device for you!
You can use your app ID to reference the files you upload to us. Refresh it anytime by tapping here.
Force using offline mode in active network test. No data connection is used in this case.
Sending SMS to an invalid destination can still cost money for some providers.
Please enter a number to which you can send SMS for free. The default \"*4*\" is an invalid number and most providers don\'t charge for SMS sent to this number.
Number of iterations for each active network test.
Evaluate active network test results on the phone only. No radio data is uploaded to our servers in this case.
You are about to refresh the app ID. Are you sure?
Your SIM card is not ready to use.\nPlease make sure that you inserted a SIM card and unlocked it.

Your current network operator or country is not in our database. You can still run the network test and contribute data.\n\n Please email to snoopsnitch@srlabs.de telling us your current country name, your current operator name and the MCC/MNC.
Please disable LTE for active network test.
SnoopSnitch\'s network scan will not work properly.
Network test and attack detection require root.
Device /dev/diag does not exist: No Qualcomm chipset or unsuitable firmware.
Your device is not properly rooted (su binary does not work).
Your device is not rooted (no su binary found).
Root access denied by su. Check permissions.
Error, no baseband messages received during active network test.
SnoopSnitch was not able to parse baseband messages, during the last run.\nIt might be that your device is not compatible,\n and therefore the main features of SnoopSnitch will not work properly.
DO NOT ENABLE THIS, unless you are a SnoopSnitch developer!
This will crash SnoopSnitch on next start and reset this option. Used for testing crash handling. Leave this off ;-)
Periodically dump start traces of catcher, security metrics and event analysis
Output additional state information, RAT changes and SQL statements from parser. Warning: This option will create a lot of logs!
Automatically upload detected events (and the corresponding GPS coordinates).
Daily upload of a database dump and the current GPS coordinates.
Sniff radio packets to pcap file (for analysis in wireshark)
Path and filename prefix for sniffing pcap files, SnoopSnitch will append a timestamp to the prefix. Defaults to /sdcard/snoopsnitch
Do you want to automatically upload all detected Events?
Please describe the problem you want to report:
Please enter your email address so that we can contact you:
Upload anonymized database metadata for suspicious events
Please select at least one item to upload
Are you sure you want to send the report without a valid email address to contact you?
Are you sure you want to send the report without a description of the problem?
Your report ID is %s. Feel free to send additional information to snoopsnitch@srlabs.de

You can choose how you want to get notified, when an IMSI catcher is detected.
You can choose how you want to get notified, when a SMS/SS7 attack is detected.
Please grant ALL requested permissions to run an Active network Test.
You have to grant ALL requested permissions to be able to run an Active network Test with SnoopSnitch
Please grant ALL requested permissions to enable running SnoopSnitch\'s background service.
You have to grant ALL requested permissions to enable SnoopSnitch\'s background service.
Please grant the access to the storage for PCAP exports.
You have to grant access to the storage to use the PCAP export feature.
You have not granted the access to the location information, so Recording will not be possible.
Please grant ALL requested information, to get all available Network
You have to grant ALL requested permissions, to get further Network information.
Creating Database failed. Please remove the App data in the Android App settings and restart SnoopSnitch. If this does not solve the problem, please reinstall SnoopSnitch.
Your device does not have a MSM Qualcomm chip, and is therefore not able to run SnoopSnitch main features.
Your device is not compatible currently. This might change with an upcoming firmware update.
Main and network security test notifications
